question.text:
Match the columns
 
Column I Column II
i. Butyric acid p. Streptomyces venezuelae
ii. SCP q. Saccharomyces cerevisiae var. ellipsoides
iii. Chloromycetin r. Clostridium
iv. Wine s. Chlorella

solution.text:
Ethanol is a type of alcohol that is a product of the fermentation process. Ethanol is widely consumed as a mix in varying degree of concentration (Wine, beer, whisky). Fermentation is an anaerobic respiratory process where many strains of Saccharomyces are used.

Clostrodium is a microbial source for commercial production of butyric acid.

Secondary metabolites like antibiotics are produced by the microbes which inhibit growth of other microbes. Chloromycetin is a type of antibiotics produced by Streptomyces venezuelae.

Microbes are used a direct source of food as they are rich in protein. Single cell protein denotes dead and dried cells of microbes where each cell is like a source of protein. Chlorella, a type of algae is used as SCP.
